Posts.Content: purple-girl12 wrote: hello everyone! am new here, im a daughter trying to help my mother in everything i can, she has bone mets and recently liver mets, now dealing with chemo and she feels tired, (because she´s tired we cannot get out of the house and thats boring for her) please i need advice on what can i say or do to cheer her up or make her think of something else that does not involve thinking of cancer (ohhh how i hate that word!!) thank you for your response!! Posts.Content: purple-girl12 wrote: hi to everyone, i recently joined to this site and only wrote one topic, when my mom on may 10 got really sick, we took her to the hospital and sadly before 7 am on may 11 her heart stop beating, she had liver mets, can't describe my feelings, after reading amazing stories of survivals, really thought my mom had a chance, i ask and pray to God why, but knowing why won't make her come back, what a horrible feeling, she was only 52, i miss her so much, can't believe i have to go on without her presence in my life, its so difficult a sadness that won't go away,,,she was a fighter and she never gave up, the only thing we wanted was going back to normal but that was just impossible, i just wanted to write some of my feelings, please keep fighting and never give up Silvia  Log in to post a reply
